books.author: by Adam Grant
books.description: An examination of the cognitive skills of rethinking and unlearning that could be used to adapt to a rapidly changing world.
books.name: THINK AGAIN

books.author: edited by Ibram X. Kendi and Keisha N. Blain
books.description: A compendium featuring 90 writers covering 400 years of African-American history.
books.name: FOUR HUNDRED SOULS

books.author: by Andy Ngo
books.description: A former writer for the online magazine Quillette gives his perspective on the activist movement antifa.
books.name: UNMASKED

books.author: by Cicely Tyson with Michelle Burford
books.description: The late iconic actress describes how she worked to change perceptions of Black women through her career choices.
books.name: JUST AS I AM

books.author: by Barack Obama
books.description: In the first volume of his presidential memoirs, Barack Obama offers personal reflections on his formative years and pivotal moments through his first term.
books.name: A PROMISED LAND

books.author: by Isabel Wilkerson
books.description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist examines aspects of caste systems across civilizations and reveals a rigid hierarchy in America today.
books.name: CASTE

books.author: by Matthew McConaughey
books.description: The Academy Award-winning actor shares snippets from the diaries he kept over the last 35 years.
books.name: GREENLIGHTS

books.author: by Glennon Doyle
books.description: The activist and public speaker describes her journey of listening to her inner voice.
books.name: UNTAMED

books.author: by Bessel van der Kolk
books.description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.
books.name: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE

books.author: by Martha Teichner
books.description: The CBS Sunday Morning correspondent develops a bond with the ailing owner of a dog she agrees to adopt.
books.name: WHEN HARRY MET MINNIE

books.author: by Michelle Obama
books.description: The former first lady describes her journey from the South Side of Chicago to the White House, and how she balanced work, family and her husband’s political ascent.
books.name: BECOMING

books.author: by Mark Harris
books.description: A biography of the award-winning theater and film director who was also half of the seminal improv duo with Elaine May.
books.name: MIKE NICHOLS

books.author: by Ibram X. Kendi
books.description: A primer for creating a more just and equitable society through identifying and opposing racism.
books.name: HOW TO BE AN ANTIRACIST

books.author: by James Nestor
books.description: A re-examination of a basic biological function and a look at the science behind ancient breathing practices.
books.name: BREATH

books.author: by Joan Didion
books.description: A collection of 12 pieces written between 1968 and 2000 that includes observations on the underground press and the act of writing.
books.name: LET ME TELL YOU WHAT I MEAN
